channel.title: Microsoft on 回风舞雪
channel.description: Recent content in Microsoft on 回风舞雪

item.title: how to export exchange logs to csv by logparser
item.description: You can download logParser from microsoft : https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/confirmation.aspx?id=24659 # 1. In short, run: LogParser "select [#Fields: date-time] as date, sender-address, recipient-address, recipient-count, return-path, client-hostname, client-ip, server-hostname, server-ip, original-client-ip, original-server-ip, event-id, total-bytes, connector-id, message-subject, source into C:\ExChange\log_all\result.csv from C:\ExChange\log_all\MessageTracking\*.LOG" -i:CSV -headerRow:on -nSkipLines:4 code above can export all logs to one csv file. -nSkipLines:4 : filter 4 lines at begin.the log files’ first 4 lines is the head of file,no need for export. [#Fields: date-time] as date : style like #Fields: date-time is complex title for csv, make it like [#Fields: date-time] can get the true info from log files. # 2.
